ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to any student who wishes to write a serious research paper. It's an excellent opportunity to work with a great professor and help you grow as a scholar and a professional.
I would recommend it as an excellent seminar in which to work on a research project that might have legs beyond the semester. Professor Van Vleck inspired me to keep pursuing my project...Very neat!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course was immensely helpful. I hope to continue to work on America's global presence, and Professor Van Vleck not only helped me with my research, but also provided an excellent introduction to the rapidly changing historiography of transnationalism.

This course encouraged me to find and pursue projects that mean something to me. Depending on how things go for me--i.e., whether I am admitted to a PhD program--I anticipate this course provided a foundation for much of the research I hope to do. Actually, whether or not a PhD happens, I look forward to doing more with the project I began in this class!
